trans-unit.source: How to use Service Bus topics (.NET) | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: How to use Service Bus topics (.NET) | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use Service Bus topics and subscriptions in Azure. Code samples are written for .NET applications.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use Service Bus topics and subscriptions in Azure. Code samples are written for .NET applications.

trans-unit.source: This article describes how to use Service Bus topics and subscriptions.
trans-unit.target: This article describes how to use Service Bus topics and subscriptions.

trans-unit.source: The samples are written in C# and use the .NET APIs.
trans-unit.target: The samples are written in C# and use the .NET APIs.

trans-unit.source: The scenarios covered include creating topics and subscriptions, creating subscription filters, sending messages to a topic, receiving messages from a subscription, and deleting topics and subscriptions.
trans-unit.target: The scenarios covered include creating topics and subscriptions, creating subscription filters, sending messages to a topic, receiving messages from a subscription, and deleting topics and subscriptions.

trans-unit.source: For more information about topics and subscriptions, see the <linkText>Next steps</linkText><title></title> section.
trans-unit.target: For more information about topics and subscriptions, see the <linkText>Next steps</linkText><title></title> section.

trans-unit.source: When you create an application that uses Service Bus, you must add a reference to the Service Bus assembly and include the corresponding namespaces.
trans-unit.target: When you create an application that uses Service Bus, you must add a reference to the Service Bus assembly and include the corresponding namespaces.

trans-unit.source: The Service Bus NuGet package is the easiest way to get the Service Bus API and to configure your application with all of the Service Bus dependencies.
trans-unit.target: The Service Bus NuGet package is the easiest way to get the Service Bus API and to configure your application with all of the Service Bus dependencies.

trans-unit.source: The NuGet Visual Studio extension makes it easy to install and update libraries and tools in Visual Studio and Visual Studio Express.
trans-unit.target: The NuGet Visual Studio extension makes it easy to install and update libraries and tools in Visual Studio and Visual Studio Express.

trans-unit.source: The Service Bus NuGet package is the easiest way to get the Service Bus API and to configure your application with all of the Service Bus dependencies.
trans-unit.target: The Service Bus NuGet package is the easiest way to get the Service Bus API and to configure your application with all of the Service Bus dependencies.

trans-unit.source: To install the NuGet package in your application, do the following:
trans-unit.target: To install the NuGet package in your application, do the following:

trans-unit.source: In Solution Explorer, right-click References, then click Manage NuGet Packages.
trans-unit.target: In Solution Explorer, right-click References, then click Manage NuGet Packages.

trans-unit.source: Search for "Service Bus" and select the Microsoft Azure Service Bus item.
trans-unit.target: Search for "Service Bus" and select the Microsoft Azure Service Bus item.

trans-unit.source: Click Install to complete the installation, then close the following dialog box.
trans-unit.target: Click Install to complete the installation, then close the following dialog box.

trans-unit.source: You are now ready to write code for Service Bus.
trans-unit.target: You are now ready to write code for Service Bus.

trans-unit.source: Service Bus uses a connection string to store endpoints and credentials.
trans-unit.target: Service Bus uses a connection string to store endpoints and credentials.

trans-unit.source: You can put your connection string in a configuration file, rather than hard-coding it:
trans-unit.target: You can put your connection string in a configuration file, rather than hard-coding it:

trans-unit.source: When using Azure Cloud Services, it is recommended that you store your connection string using the Azure service configuration system (.csdef and .cscfg files).
trans-unit.target: When using Azure Cloud Services, it is recommended that you store your connection string using the Azure service configuration system (.csdef and .cscfg files).

trans-unit.source: When using Azure websites or Azure Virtual Machines, it is recommended that you store your connection string using the .NET configuration system (for example, the Web.config file).
trans-unit.target: When using Azure websites or Azure Virtual Machines, it is recommended that you store your connection string using the .NET configuration system (for example, the Web.config file).

trans-unit.source: In both cases, you can retrieve your connection string using the CloudConfigurationManager.GetSetting method, as shown later in this article.
trans-unit.target: In both cases, you can retrieve your connection string using the CloudConfigurationManager.GetSetting method, as shown later in this article.

trans-unit.source: The service configuration mechanism is unique to Azure Cloud Services projects and enables you to dynamically change configuration settings from the Azure portal without redeploying your application.
trans-unit.target: The service configuration mechanism is unique to Azure Cloud Services projects and enables you to dynamically change configuration settings from the Azure portal without redeploying your application.

trans-unit.source: For example, add a Setting label to your service definition (*.csdef) file, as shown in the next example.
trans-unit.target: For example, add a Setting label to your service definition (*.csdef) file, as shown in the next example.

trans-unit.source: You then specify values in the service configuration (.cscfg) file.
trans-unit.target: You then specify values in the service configuration (.cscfg) file.

trans-unit.source: Use the Shared Access Signature (SAS) key name and key values retrieved from the Azure portal as described in the previous section.
trans-unit.target: Use the Shared Access Signature (SAS) key name and key values retrieved from the Azure portal as described in the previous section.

trans-unit.source: When using websites or Virtual Machines, it is recommended you use the .NET configuration system (for example, Web.config). You store the connection string using the element.
trans-unit.target: When using websites or Virtual Machines, it is recommended you use the .NET configuration system (for example, Web.config). You store the connection string using the element.

trans-unit.source: Use the SAS name and key values that you retrieved from the Azure portal, as described in the previous section.
trans-unit.target: Use the SAS name and key values that you retrieved from the Azure portal, as described in the previous section.

trans-unit.source: You can perform management operations for Service Bus topics and subscriptions using the [NamespaceManager](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/microsoft.servicebus.namespacemanager.aspx) class.
trans-unit.target: You can perform management operations for Service Bus topics and subscriptions using the [NamespaceManager](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/microsoft.servicebus.namespacemanager.aspx) class.

trans-unit.source: This class provides methods to create, enumerate, and delete topics.
trans-unit.target: This class provides methods to create, enumerate, and delete topics.

trans-unit.source: The following example constructs a NamespaceManager object using the Azure CloudConfigurationManager class with a connection string consisting of the base address of a Service Bus service namespace and the appropriate SAS credentials with permissions to manage it.
trans-unit.target: The following example constructs a NamespaceManager object using the Azure CloudConfigurationManager class with a connection string consisting of the base address of a Service Bus service namespace and the appropriate SAS credentials with permissions to manage it.

trans-unit.source: This connection string is of the following form.
trans-unit.target: This connection string is of the following form.

trans-unit.source: Use the following example, given the configuration settings in the previous section.
trans-unit.target: Use the following example, given the configuration settings in the previous section.

trans-unit.source: There are overloads of the [CreateTopic](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/microsoft.servicebus.namespacemanager.createtopic.aspx) method that enable you to tune properties of the topic, for example, to set the default "time-to-live" value to be applied to messages sent to the topic.
trans-unit.target: There are overloads of the [CreateTopic](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/microsoft.servicebus.namespacemanager.createtopic.aspx) method that enable you to tune properties of the topic, for example, to set the default "time-to-live" value to be applied to messages sent to the topic.

trans-unit.source: These settings are applied by using the [TopicDescription](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/microsoft.servicebus.messaging.topicdescription.aspx) class.
trans-unit.target: These settings are applied by using the [TopicDescription](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/microsoft.servicebus.messaging.topicdescription.aspx) class.

trans-unit.source: The following example shows how to create a topic named TestTopic with a maximum size of 5 GB and a default message time-to-live of 1 minute.
trans-unit.target: The following example shows how to create a topic named TestTopic with a maximum size of 5 GB and a default message time-to-live of 1 minute.

trans-unit.source: You can use the [TopicExists](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/microsoft.servicebus.namespacemanager.topicexists.aspx) method on [NamespaceManager](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/microsoft.servicebus.namespacemanager.aspx) objects to check whether a topic with a specified name already exists within a service namespace.
trans-unit.target: You can use the [TopicExists](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/microsoft.servicebus.namespacemanager.topicexists.aspx) method on [NamespaceManager](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/microsoft.servicebus.namespacemanager.aspx) objects to check whether a topic with a specified name already exists within a service namespace.

trans-unit.source: You can also create topic subscriptions using the [NamespaceManager](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/microsoft.servicebus.namespacemanager.aspx) class.
trans-unit.target: You can also create topic subscriptions using the [NamespaceManager](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/microsoft.servicebus.namespacemanager.aspx) class.

trans-unit.source: Subscriptions are named and can have an optional filter that restricts the set of messages passed to the subscription's virtual queue.
trans-unit.target: Subscriptions are named and can have an optional filter that restricts the set of messages passed to the subscription's virtual queue.

trans-unit.source: The MatchAll filter is the default filter that is used if no filter is specified when a new subscription is created.
trans-unit.target: The MatchAll filter is the default filter that is used if no filter is specified when a new subscription is created.

trans-unit.source: When you use the MatchAll filter, all messages published to the topic are placed in the subscription's virtual queue.
trans-unit.target: When you use the MatchAll filter, all messages published to the topic are placed in the subscription's virtual queue.

trans-unit.source: The following example creates a subscription named "AllMessages" and uses the default MatchAll filter.
trans-unit.target: The following example creates a subscription named "AllMessages" and uses the default MatchAll filter.

trans-unit.source: You can also set up filters that enable you to specify which messages sent to a topic should appear within a specific topic subscription.
trans-unit.target: You can also set up filters that enable you to specify which messages sent to a topic should appear within a specific topic subscription.

trans-unit.source: The most flexible type of filter supported by subscriptions is the [SqlFilter] class, which implements a subset of SQL92.
trans-unit.target: The most flexible type of filter supported by subscriptions is the [SqlFilter] class, which implements a subset of SQL92.

trans-unit.source: SQL filters operate on the properties of the messages that are published to the topic.
trans-unit.target: SQL filters operate on the properties of the messages that are published to the topic.

trans-unit.source: For more information about the expressions that can be used with a SQL filter, see the <linkText>SqlFilter.SqlExpression</linkText><title></title> syntax.
trans-unit.target: For more information about the expressions that can be used with a SQL filter, see the <linkText>SqlFilter.SqlExpression</linkText><title></title> syntax.

trans-unit.source: The following example creates a subscription named HighMessages with a [SqlFilter] object that only selects messages that have a custom MessageNumber property greater than 3.
trans-unit.target: The following example creates a subscription named HighMessages with a [SqlFilter] object that only selects messages that have a custom MessageNumber property greater than 3.

trans-unit.source: Similarly, the following example creates a subscription named LowMessages with a [SqlFilter] that only selects messages that have a MessageNumber property less than or equal to 3.
trans-unit.target: Similarly, the following example creates a subscription named LowMessages with a [SqlFilter] that only selects messages that have a MessageNumber property less than or equal to 3.

trans-unit.source: Now when a message is sent to TestTopic, it is always delivered to receivers subscribed to the AllMessages topic subscription, and selectively delivered to receivers subscribed to the HighMessages and LowMessages topic subscriptions (depending on the message content).
trans-unit.target: Now when a message is sent to TestTopic, it is always delivered to receivers subscribed to the AllMessages topic subscription, and selectively delivered to receivers subscribed to the HighMessages and LowMessages topic subscriptions (depending on the message content).

trans-unit.source: To send a message to a Service Bus topic, your application creates a [TopicClient](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/microsoft.servicebus.messaging.topicclient.aspx) object using the connection string.
trans-unit.target: To send a message to a Service Bus topic, your application creates a [TopicClient](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/microsoft.servicebus.messaging.topicclient.aspx) object using the connection string.

trans-unit.source: The following code demonstrates how to create a [TopicClient](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/microsoft.servicebus.messaging.topicclient.aspx) object for the TestTopic topic created earlier using the [CreateFromConnectionString](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/microsoft.servicebus.messaging.topicclient.createfromconnectionstring.aspx) API call.
trans-unit.target: The following code demonstrates how to create a [TopicClient](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/microsoft.servicebus.messaging.topicclient.aspx) object for the TestTopic topic created earlier using the [CreateFromConnectionString](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/microsoft.servicebus.messaging.topicclient.createfromconnectionstring.aspx) API call.

trans-unit.source: Messages sent to Service Bus topics are instances of the [BrokeredMessage](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/microsoft.servicebus.messaging.brokeredmessage.aspx) class.
trans-unit.target: Messages sent to Service Bus topics are instances of the [BrokeredMessage](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/microsoft.servicebus.messaging.brokeredmessage.aspx) class.

trans-unit.source: BrokeredMessage objects have a set of standard properties (such as [Label](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/microsoft.servicebus.messaging.brokeredmessage.label.aspx) and [TimeToLive](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/microsoft.servicebus.messaging.brokeredmessage.timetolive.aspx)), a dictionary that is used to hold custom application-specific properties, and a body of arbitrary application data.
trans-unit.target: BrokeredMessage objects have a set of standard properties (such as [Label](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/microsoft.servicebus.messaging.brokeredmessage.label.aspx) and [TimeToLive](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/microsoft.servicebus.messaging.brokeredmessage.timetolive.aspx)), a dictionary that is used to hold custom application-specific properties, and a body of arbitrary application data.

trans-unit.source: An application can set the body of the message by passing any serializable object to the constructor of the [BrokeredMessage](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/microsoft.servicebus.messaging.brokeredmessage.aspx) object, and the appropriate DataContractSerializer is then used to serialize the object.
trans-unit.target: An application can set the body of the message by passing any serializable object to the constructor of the [BrokeredMessage](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/microsoft.servicebus.messaging.brokeredmessage.aspx) object, and the appropriate DataContractSerializer is then used to serialize the object.

trans-unit.source: Alternatively, a System.IO.Stream can be provided.
trans-unit.target: Alternatively, a System.IO.Stream can be provided.

trans-unit.source: The following example demonstrates how to send five test messages to the TestTopic [TopicClient](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/microsoft.servicebus.messaging.topicclient.aspx) object obtained in the previous code example.
trans-unit.target: The following example demonstrates how to send five test messages to the TestTopic [TopicClient](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/microsoft.servicebus.messaging.topicclient.aspx) object obtained in the previous code example.

trans-unit.source: Note that the [MessageNumber](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/microsoft.servicebus.messaging.brokeredmessage.properties.aspx) property value of each message varies depending on the iteration of the loop (this determines which subscriptions receive it).
trans-unit.target: Note that the [MessageNumber](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/microsoft.servicebus.messaging.brokeredmessage.properties.aspx) property value of each message varies depending on the iteration of the loop (this determines which subscriptions receive it).

trans-unit.source: Service Bus topics support a <linkText>maximum message size of 256 KB</linkText><title></title> (the header, which includes the standard and custom application properties, can have a maximum size of 64 KB).
trans-unit.target: Service Bus topics support a <linkText>maximum message size of 256 KB</linkText><title></title> (the header, which includes the standard and custom application properties, can have a maximum size of 64 KB).

trans-unit.source: There is no limit on the number of messages held in a topic but there is a cap on the total size of the messages held by a topic.
trans-unit.target: There is no limit on the number of messages held in a topic but there is a cap on the total size of the messages held by a topic.

trans-unit.source: This topic size is defined at creation time, with an upper limit of 5 GB.
trans-unit.target: This topic size is defined at creation time, with an upper limit of 5 GB.

trans-unit.source: If partitioning is enabled, the upper limit is higher.
trans-unit.target: If partitioning is enabled, the upper limit is higher.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <linkText>Partitioning Messaging Entities</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <linkText>Partitioning Messaging Entities</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: The recommended way to receive messages from a subscription is to use a [SubscriptionClient](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/microsoft.servicebus.messaging.subscriptionclient.aspx) object.
trans-unit.target: The recommended way to receive messages from a subscription is to use a [SubscriptionClient](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/microsoft.servicebus.messaging.subscriptionclient.aspx) object.

trans-unit.source: SubscriptionClient objects can work in two different modes: [ReceiveAndDelete and PeekLock](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/microsoft.servicebus.messaging.receivemode.aspx).
trans-unit.target: SubscriptionClient objects can work in two different modes: [ReceiveAndDelete and PeekLock](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/microsoft.servicebus.messaging.receivemode.aspx).

trans-unit.source: When using the ReceiveAndDelete mode, receive is a single-shot operation - that is, when Service Bus receives a read request for a message in a subscription, it marks the message as being consumed and returns it to the application.
trans-unit.target: When using the ReceiveAndDelete mode, receive is a single-shot operation - that is, when Service Bus receives a read request for a message in a subscription, it marks the message as being consumed and returns it to the application.

trans-unit.source: ReceiveAndDelete mode is the simplest model and works best for scenarios in which an application can tolerate not processing a message in the event of a failure.
trans-unit.target: ReceiveAndDelete mode is the simplest model and works best for scenarios in which an application can tolerate not processing a message in the event of a failure.

trans-unit.source: To understand this, consider a scenario in which the consumer issues the receive request and then crashes before processing it.
trans-unit.target: To understand this, consider a scenario in which the consumer issues the receive request and then crashes before processing it.

trans-unit.source: Because Service Bus will have marked the message as consumed, when the application restarts and begins consuming messages again, it will have missed the message that was consumed prior to the crash.
trans-unit.target: Because Service Bus will have marked the message as consumed, when the application restarts and begins consuming messages again, it will have missed the message that was consumed prior to the crash.

trans-unit.source: In PeekLock mode (which is the default mode), the receive process becomes a two-stage operation which makes it possible to support applications that cannot tolerate missing messages.
trans-unit.target: In PeekLock mode (which is the default mode), the receive process becomes a two-stage operation which makes it possible to support applications that cannot tolerate missing messages.

trans-unit.source: When Service Bus receives a request, it finds the next message to be consumed, locks it to prevent other consumers receiving it, and then returns it to the application.
trans-unit.target: When Service Bus receives a request, it finds the next message to be consumed, locks it to prevent other consumers receiving it, and then returns it to the application.

trans-unit.source: After the application finishes processing the message (or stores it reliably for future processing), it completes the second stage of the receive process by calling [Complete](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/microsoft.servicebus.messaging.brokeredmessage.complete.aspx) on the received message.
trans-unit.target: After the application finishes processing the message (or stores it reliably for future processing), it completes the second stage of the receive process by calling [Complete](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/microsoft.servicebus.messaging.brokeredmessage.complete.aspx) on the received message.

trans-unit.source: When Service Bus sees the Complete call, it marks the message as being consumed and removes it from the subscription.
trans-unit.target: When Service Bus sees the Complete call, it marks the message as being consumed and removes it from the subscription.

trans-unit.source: The following example demonstrates how messages can be received and processed using the default PeekLock mode.
trans-unit.target: The following example demonstrates how messages can be received and processed using the default PeekLock mode.

trans-unit.source: To specify a different [ReceiveMode](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/microsoft.servicebus.messaging.receivemode.aspx) value, you can use another overload for [CreateFromConnectionString](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/microsoft.servicebus.messaging.subscriptionclient.createfromconnectionstring.aspx).
trans-unit.target: To specify a different [ReceiveMode](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/microsoft.servicebus.messaging.receivemode.aspx) value, you can use another overload for [CreateFromConnectionString](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/microsoft.servicebus.messaging.subscriptionclient.createfromconnectionstring.aspx).

trans-unit.source: This example uses the [OnMessage](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/microsoft.servicebus.messaging.subscriptionclient.onmessage.aspx) callback to process messages as they arrive in the HighMessages subscription.
trans-unit.target: This example uses the [OnMessage](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/microsoft.servicebus.messaging.subscriptionclient.onmessage.aspx) callback to process messages as they arrive in the HighMessages subscription.

trans-unit.source: This example configures the [OnMessage](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/microsoft.servicebus.messaging.subscriptionclient.onmessage.aspx) callback using an [OnMessageOptions](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/microsoft.servicebus.messaging.onmessageoptions.aspx) object.
trans-unit.target: This example configures the [OnMessage](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/microsoft.servicebus.messaging.subscriptionclient.onmessage.aspx) callback using an [OnMessageOptions](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/microsoft.servicebus.messaging.onmessageoptions.aspx) object.

trans-unit.source: [AutoComplete](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/microsoft.servicebus.messaging.onmessageoptions.autocomplete.aspx) is set to false to enable manual control of when to call [Complete](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/microsoft.servicebus.messaging.brokeredmessage.complete.aspx) on the received message.
trans-unit.target: [AutoComplete](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/microsoft.servicebus.messaging.onmessageoptions.autocomplete.aspx) is set to false to enable manual control of when to call [Complete](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/microsoft.servicebus.messaging.brokeredmessage.complete.aspx) on the received message.

trans-unit.source: [AutoRenewTimeout](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/microsoft.servicebus.messaging.onmessageoptions.autorenewtimeout.aspx) is set to 1 minute, which causes the client to wait for up to one minute for a message before the call times out and the client makes a new call to check for messages.
trans-unit.target: [AutoRenewTimeout](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/microsoft.servicebus.messaging.onmessageoptions.autorenewtimeout.aspx) is set to 1 minute, which causes the client to wait for up to one minute for a message before the call times out and the client makes a new call to check for messages.

trans-unit.source: This property value reduces the number of times the client makes chargeable calls that do not retrieve messages.
trans-unit.target: This property value reduces the number of times the client makes chargeable calls that do not retrieve messages.

trans-unit.source: Service Bus provides functionality to help you gracefully recover from errors in your application or difficulties processing a message.
trans-unit.target: Service Bus provides functionality to help you gracefully recover from errors in your application or difficulties processing a message.

trans-unit.source: If a receiving application is unable to process the message for some reason, then it can call the [Abandon](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/microsoft.servicebus.messaging.brokeredmessage.abandon.aspx) method on the received message (instead of the [Complete](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/microsoft.servicebus.messaging.brokeredmessage.complete.aspx) method).
trans-unit.target: If a receiving application is unable to process the message for some reason, then it can call the [Abandon](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/microsoft.servicebus.messaging.brokeredmessage.abandon.aspx) method on the received message (instead of the [Complete](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/microsoft.servicebus.messaging.brokeredmessage.complete.aspx) method).

trans-unit.source: This causes Service Bus to unlock the message within the subscription and make it available to be received again, either by the same consuming application or by another consuming application.
trans-unit.target: This causes Service Bus to unlock the message within the subscription and make it available to be received again, either by the same consuming application or by another consuming application.

trans-unit.source: There is also a time-out associated with a message locked within the subscription, and if the application fails to process the message before the lock time-out expires (for example, if the application crashes), then Service Bus unlocks the message automatically and makes it available to be received again.
trans-unit.target: There is also a time-out associated with a message locked within the subscription, and if the application fails to process the message before the lock time-out expires (for example, if the application crashes), then Service Bus unlocks the message automatically and makes it available to be received again.

trans-unit.source: In the event that the application crashes after processing the message but before the [Complete](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/microsoft.servicebus.messaging.brokeredmessage.complete.aspx) request is issued, the message will be redelivered to the application when it restarts.
trans-unit.target: In the event that the application crashes after processing the message but before the [Complete](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/microsoft.servicebus.messaging.brokeredmessage.complete.aspx) request is issued, the message will be redelivered to the application when it restarts.

trans-unit.source: This is often called At Least Once Processing; that is, each message is processed at least once but in certain situations the same message may be redelivered.
trans-unit.target: This is often called At Least Once Processing; that is, each message is processed at least once but in certain situations the same message may be redelivered.

trans-unit.source: If the scenario cannot tolerate duplicate processing, then application developers should add additional logic to their application to handle duplicate message delivery.
trans-unit.target: If the scenario cannot tolerate duplicate processing, then application developers should add additional logic to their application to handle duplicate message delivery.

trans-unit.source: This is often achieved using the [MessageId](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/microsoft.servicebus.messaging.brokeredmessage.messageid.aspx) property of the message, which will remain constant across delivery attempts.
trans-unit.target: This is often achieved using the [MessageId](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/microsoft.servicebus.messaging.brokeredmessage.messageid.aspx) property of the message, which will remain constant across delivery attempts.

trans-unit.source: The following example demonstrates how to delete the topic TestTopic from the HowToSample service namespace.
trans-unit.target: The following example demonstrates how to delete the topic TestTopic from the HowToSample service namespace.

trans-unit.source: Deleting a topic also deletes any subscriptions that are registered with the topic.
trans-unit.target: Deleting a topic also deletes any subscriptions that are registered with the topic.

trans-unit.source: Subscriptions can also be deleted independently.
trans-unit.target: Subscriptions can also be deleted independently.

trans-unit.source: The following code demonstrates how to delete a subscription named HighMessages from the TestTopic topic.
trans-unit.target: The following code demonstrates how to delete a subscription named HighMessages from the TestTopic topic.

trans-unit.target: Now that you've learned the basics of Service Bus topics and subscriptions, follow these links to learn more.

trans-unit.target: Build a working application that sends and receives messages to and from a Service Bus queue: <linkText>Service Bus Brokered Messaging .NET Tutorial</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.target: Service Bus samples: Download from <linkText>Azure Samples</linkText><title></title> or see the overview on <linkText>MSDN</linkText><title></title>.
